item.title: \> cat 'Study Spaces'
item.description: Some of my favorite Boston-area cafes to study in. Perfect for a warm cup of coffee and a soft ambience to get cozy in the terminal for a few hours. Pavement Coffee My go-to spot for a productive morning, nestled conveniently close to campus. Sweet matcha lattes, hearty bagels. Spacious but quickly fills with the gentle hum of studious, socializing college kids. Ogawa Coffee Coming from Japan with their first international shop here, Ogawa undoubtedly serves the best matcha in Boston.

item.title: \> history
item.description: Random ideas I’ve made in the past Cyber-Related Ongoing CTF Club Challenges As Co-Founder and VP of CTF club, I make challenges for meetings and competitions, ranging in difficulty and topic to introduce all skill levels to various cybersecurity areas. 01-2024 Sniffer | Python Sniff unencrypted credentials sent through less secure protocols by poisoning a target’s ARP cache and redirect all traffic through the attacking system. 12-2023 Shadow Deletion | Bash

item.title: \> ls -R
item.description: Various resources I’ve used to learn and practice: Hands-On Practice Hack the Box TryHackMe VulnHub pwn.college PentesterLab SadServers Over the Wire: Wargames Pwnable.tw Smash the Stack CTFs CTF Time PicoCTF CTF Learn CTF101 Awesome-CTF Awesome Penetration Testing CTF Writeups HackTricks ired.team Notes Papers and Books Linux Hardening In Hostile Networks: Server Security From TLS To Tor Mastering Linux Security and Hardening Learn Penetration Testing Penetration Testing: A Survival Guide News The Hacker News Bleeping Computer Threatpost Dark Reading CISA Exploited Vulnerabilities CISA Advisories Youtubers The Linux Experiment Low Level Learning Network Chuck John Hammond Fireship Dreams of Code Wolfgang’s Channel LiveOverflow Misc.

item.title: \> whoami
item.description: I’m Shannon, a senior studying cybersecurity at Northeastern University. Here you’ll find a collection of what I’m currently learning, small personal projects, educational resources I’ve found useful, and brief reviews of my favorite Boston-area coffee shops to study in. I’m primarily interested in: + Security Engineering + DevSecOps + Penetration Testing I enjoy crafting secure and resilient code to drive operational efficiencies, address complex security challenges, and fortify evolving cyber landscapes.
